jurisdiction.title: Immaculate Conception of Dardenne Catholic School

A25E0CF806F94864B2871CBDEE36E9FC.description: Analyze data from tests of two objects designed to solve the same problem to compare the strengths and weaknesses of how each performs

07321B13EAA44CA29B87724A8A3C546C.description: Develop a simple sketch, drawing, or physical model to illustrate how the shape of an object helps it function as needed to solve a given problem

7CFD98431FFA46DD9E7599BF1EA77F94.description: Ask questions, make observations, and gather information about a situation people want to change to define a simple problem that can be solved through the development of a new or improved object or tool

350C50C9A1254D2686C3C63E9C29F741.description: Obtain information to identify where water is found on Earth and that it can be solid or liquid

1A32F9DB247646A0B2F23479B56F54C8.description: Develop a model to represent the shapes and kinds of land and bodies of water in an area

48D1EEF06087404BA022D1AD5A07EF42.description: Use information from several sources to provide evidence that Earth events can occur quickly or slowly [Clarification Statement: Examples of events and timescales could include volcanic explosions and earthquakes, which happen quickly, and erosion of rocks, which occurs slowly.]

8BF270D3D2074058BFB4C3F01802327F.description: Develop a model to compare and contrast observations on the life cycle of different plants and animals [Clarification Statement: Changes that organisms go through during their life form a pattern.]

90E8B4A9895B43BF9AFE2631B3972297.description: Make observations of plants and animals to compare the diversity of life in different habitats [Clarification Statement: Emphasis is on the diversity of living things in each of a variety of different habitats.]

2310AD86F908429181E6C7F831951565.description: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants

48B05D6BC914471B90875AF763BB6ACB.description: Plan and conduct investigations on the growth of plants when growing conditions are altered (i.e. dark vs. light, water vs. no water)

62B77DACCA0A4EEA984F247C67E82F6F.description: Predict and investigate that water can change from a liquid to a solid (freeze) and back again (melt), or from a liquid to a gas (evaporation) and back again (condensation) as the result of temperature changes

2A801C9D8B9940CF8A2C5F86F37D6118.description: Construct an argument with evidence that some changes caused by heating or cooling can be reversed and some cannot [Clarification Statement: Examples of reversible changes could include materials such as water and butter at different temperatures. Examples of irreversible changes could include cooking an egg, freezing a plant leaf, and heating paper.]

403EBD990A0D40C2B7B4309C34505B27.description: Make observations to construct an evidence-based account of how an object made of a small set of pieces can be disassembled and made into a new object [Clarification Statement: Examples of pieces could include blocks, building bricks, or other assorted small objects.]

61AC06D92484443DB68C310E40C58357.description: Analyze data obtained from testing different materials to determine which materials have the properties that are best suited for an intended purpose [Clarification Statement: Examples of properties could include strength, flexibility, hardness, texture, and absorbency.]

4A700FAE4AED49CC857F201C604017BA.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties [Clarification Statement: Observations could include color, texture, hardness, and flexibility. Patterns could include the similar properties that different materials share.]
